instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: Macbook pro 15’ touchbar <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutsdown randomly
threads.message:
Hello, im got issue after liquid damage( logic board was cleared up and worked well couple mounths, but yesterday it starts random shut down. Some time i can run system and it works well, but sometimes it shuts down randomly, and proceeds shuts down after apple logo showing up. Could any one help me figure out what is goin on, i have attached photos was taked before clearing up after water damage.

upd: i have service 
engeneer, he working now trying to solve this issue, could any one advise me what nessesary checks/steps should he made to try fix it on my laptop.

threads.title: Macbook pro 15’ touchbar <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Shutsdown randomly
threads.message:
Use good flux and reflow all BGA chips.
I think about crap underneath...
